name: Glean Lore
summary: You tap into the collected lore of the divine, accessing a variety of potentially useful information.

name: Reach Spell
trait: Bard, Cleric, Concentrate, Druid, Oracle, Sorcerer, Spellshape, Witch, Wizard
summary: You can extend your spells’ range.

name: Widen Spell
trait: Druid, Manipulate, Oracle, Sorcerer, Spellshape, Witch, Wizard
summary: You manipulate the energy of your spell, causing it to spread out and affect a wider area.

name: Cantrip Expansion
trait: Bard, Cleric, Magus, Oracle, Psychic, Sorcerer, Witch, Wizard
summary: Study broadens your range of simple spells.

name: Divine Aegis
summary: You summon divine energy to shield yourself, offering protection against other traditions but leaving you exposed to other divine effects.

name: Domain Acumen
summary: Every oracle's mystery touches on a divine domain of the deities that fuel it; you can access that power.

name: Bespell Strikes
summary: You siphon spell energy into one weapon you’re wielding, or into one of your unarmed attacks, such as a fist.

name: Divine Access
summary: Your ability to tap into divine magic surpasses the spells traditionally available to you (the divine spell list).

name: Irezoko Tattoo
source: <row gap="tiny">Absalom, City of Lost Omens pg. 185</row>
trait: Bard, Champion, Cleric, Druid, Magus, Monk, Oracle, Psychic, Ranger, Sorcerer, Summoner, Uncommon, Witch, Wizard
prerequisite: Expert in Arcana or Expert in Occultism
summary: Your face bears an intricate magical tattoo known as the _irezoko_, a badge of your understanding of your chosen field of magic and a recognition of your advancement within Absalom's College of Mysteries.

name: Prayer-Touched Weapon
prerequisite: divine spells, you follow a good-aligned deity
summary: You coat a weapon you're wielding in prayers and the divine power given to you by your deity.

name: Sacral Lord
prerequisite: Trained in Occultism or Trained in Religion
summary: By right of ritual or sheer stubbornness, you have claimed rulership of the land.

name: Undying Conviction
trait: Aura, Cleric, Necromancy, Oracle, Uncommon, Wizard
prerequisite: able to create or control undead; cleric with a negative font, oracle of bones, or necromancer wizard
summary: Your presence has a bolstering effect on your undead minions.

name: Vision of Weakness
summary: You can call upon divine insights to single out your foes' weak points.

name: Advanced Revelation
summary: You learn an advanced revelation spell associated with your mystery.

name: Detonating Spell
trait: Cleric, Concentrate, Metamagic, Oracle, Sorcerer, Uncommon, Witch, Wizard
summary: Your spell becomes volatile and explosive.

name: Spiritual Sense
summary: You have a vague connection to the Ethereal Plane that enables you to notice spirits.

name: Steady Spellcasting
trait: Bard, Cleric, Druid, Oracle, Psychic, Sorcerer, Witch, Wizard
summary: You don’t lose spells easily. If a reaction would disrupt your spellcasting action, attempt a DC 15 flat check. If you succeed, your action isn’t disrupted.

name: Chaotic Spell
trait: Bard, Manipulate, Metamagic, Oracle, Sorcerer, Uncommon, Witch, Wizard
summary: Your foe can hardly predict and counter your moves if you yourself have no idea what will happen.

name: Debilitating Dichotomy
summary: You can give others a glimpse of the impossible conflicts and unchecked power that courses through your body.

name: Read Disaster
summary: You spend 10 minutes and open yourself to the divine mysteries of the world, peering into the most sinister portents of the future.

name: Consecrate Spell
trait: Cleric, Concentrate, Metamagic, Oracle, Sorcerer, Uncommon
prerequisite: ability to cast focus spells, divine spells
summary: You infuse a spell with the power of your faith, consecrating it.

name: Oracular Warning
summary: You have a flash of insight about impending danger related to one ally, and you can shout or gesture to warn that ally of the threat a moment before it materializes.

name: Quickened Casting
trait: Bard, Concentrate, Oracle, Sorcerer, Spellshape, Witch, Wizard
summary: If your next action is to cast a cantrip or a spell that is at least 2 ranks lower than the highest-rank spell slot you have, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).

name: Surging Might
summary: With a complex gesture, you focus the divine power of your spell to overcome enemies' resistances.

name: Domain Fluency
summary: You command a deep understanding of the divine domains related to your mystery.

name: Greater Revelation
summary: You learn a greater revelation spell associated with your mystery.

name: Magic Sense
trait: Arcane, Detection, Magus, Oracle, Sorcerer, Wizard
summary: You have a literal sixth sense for ambient magic in your vicinity.

name: Necromancer's Visage
prerequisite: ability to create or control undead; cleric with a negative font, oracle of bones, or necromancer wizard
summary: Necromantic energy demonstrates your power over undead, creating a demeanor that commands their fear and respect.

name: Forestall Curse
summary: You've learned to forestall the effects of your curse somewhat.

name: Mysterious Repertoire
summary: Your mystery holds unknowable depths of magic not always associated with the divine.

name: Purifying Breeze
summary: You transfer the divine essence of your magic to the air around you, cleansing it of toxins.

name: Sacral Monarch
prerequisite: Sacral Lord; Master in Occultism or Master in Religion
summary: You have come into your full powers and are truly a monarch of your realm, by your own definition at least.

name: Sepulchral Sublimation
trait: Cleric, Concentrate, Metamagic, Necromancy, Oracle, Uncommon, Wizard
prerequisite: ability to create or control undead; cleric with a negative font, oracle of bones, or necromancer wizard
summary: You repurpose the negative energy that flows through your minions at a moment's notice.

name: Diverse Mystery
summary: You have broadened your understanding of the divine and can tap into the wonders of a different mystery.

name: Portentous Spell
summary: Your spellcasting is rife with strange lights, esoteric gestures, and other captivating effects that befuddle your foes.

name: Blaze of Revelation
summary: Your mind and body can, for a short time, withstand the devastation of overdrawing your curse.

name: Divine Effusion
summary: The power of your mystery surges through you like a font of divine energy, even when your own magic dwindles.

name: Mystery Conduit
summary: The power of your mystery enables you to cast more than just revelation spells.

name: Oracular Providence
summary: Your mystery grants you access to deep reserves of truly miraculous divine power.

name: Paradoxical Mystery
summary: The truest depths of your divine mystery are fathomless and contradictory, granting you changing powers that even you can barely begin to fathom.

name: Scapegoat Parallel Self
source: <row gap="tiny">Pathfinder #168: King of the Mountain pg. 76</row>
summary: You've realized a way to manipulate the effects of your oracular curse.
